column1: Different portions of the Tongue specialize in sensing different flavors/tastes
column2: Taste receptors for all tastes are fairly evenly distributed across the tongue.  This misconception stems for a mistranslation of a 1901 German thesis.  Also, there are 5 primary tastes: sweet, sour, salty, bitter, and umami/savory.

column1: Human beings only use 10% of their brain
column2: Human beings utilize their entire brain, although different areas are active during different processes.

column1: Humans are the most evolved species or evolution leads to more complex species
column2: Evolution is not a progression from inferior to superior, or simple to complex.  Similarly, we are NOT evolved from monkeys or more evolved than monkeys.  Monkeys and mankind descend from a common ancestor

column1: Sugar levels cause hyperactivity, especially in children
column2: Interest and activity level can result in childhood hyperactivity and listlessness; sugar has nothing to do with it.

column1: Women are born with all the eggs they will ever have
column2: Women generate new eggs throughout their entire life until menopause

column1: Consuming Antioxidants is an effective way to fight aging; or, more generally, that consumption of increased antioxidants has any health benefit.
column2: Since the proposal of the free radical theory of ageing in the 1950s, numerous large and rigourous studies have found no evidence that free radicals are responsible for ageing, and in fact, increased antioxidant consumption can have serious negative consequences.
